#### Security Requirements

#### Description
Health Canada is seeking a contractor to provide Employee Assistance Program (EAP) services for its Specialized Health Services Employees and their Immediate Family Members on an as and when requested basis. The Contract is expected to be three years with two additional one year option periods which can be exercised by Canada at its sole discretion.

Health Canada’s Specialized Health Services Directorate is responsible for providing EAP services to its employees using two different service delivery models: internal and external. This solicitation only pertains to the external component of the EAP service.

**Scope of Work**
The Contractor must provide the following EAP services on behalf of Health Canada:

1. Intake services
2. Short-term counseling services
3. Crisis Intervention services
4. Specialized consultative services
5. Advisory services
6. Well-being documentation
7. National EAP Account Manager
8. Program monitoring and quality control services
9. Website and secure web portal
10. Access to digital application (app)
11. Facilities for face-to-face counseling services
12. CISM services
13. Orientation and wellness sessions
14. Promotional and information
